text: Tom bolts up and is about to scream when a dirty hand clamps over his mouth.
Shhh...  Back lit against the window we see the silhouette of Huckleberry Finn. __..
(whispering, nasty) Scared? You should be.
{catching his breath) Huck -- what are you doing?? 87 Huck shoves the pine shingle in Tom's face -- their oath of secrecy.
Remember this?

Accordin' to this, you should be dead and startin’ to rot about now.
I had to help Muff. Not to help him woulda been wrong.
You swore an oath. You swore. Don't that mean anything?
Not if it's gonna end up hurtin’ someone.
Well, the "someone" that's gonna be hurt turns out to be you. And you better keep me out of it! This is your mess...
Huck... Wait.7. But in a flash, Huck is out the window and down the tree... And Tom is left alone in the dark.
CLOSE on Tom running through a cornfield. Ar first, we think Tom is running from something. Then, we see that he's running toward...

The big Harvest Celebration is underway. This is a celebration that traces its roots to pagan times, combining aspects of the Harvest Home and All Hallow's Eve. a Food is everywhere. There are games and contests, played by children and adults. Kids bob for apples in tubs of water. A BAND plays popular songs. The whole town has turned out... —- “We FIND Old Tim who's Entertaining a group of wide-ey kids.

If you go to the crossroads and | listen to the wind, you can ' learn all the most important things that will befall you in the next twelve months. MOVING THROUGH, we FIND Becky and a group of GIRLS are enacting an old superstitious rite to foretell your husband. The girls stand in line with eyes closed and ' chant:
"I sew hemp seed and he who is j to be my husband, -let him come and harrow it." The girls toss seeds over their shoulders, giggling and enjoying their silliness.

Now turn and you shall see the form of your husband. The girls turn but there's only an empty field behind them. They laugh and go off to some other activity. Except for Becky. “She hesitates. Suddenly, Tom emerges from the adjacent cornfield. He walks up to her...
(a shy smile) Hello, Becky. Becky lets out a gasp.
Oh, no! 7 Embarrassed, Becky turn sand flees. Tom runs after her. He catches her but she won't look him in the eye.
What's wrong? Am I that bad to look at?
(blurting) We're going to be married!

(miffed) Well, you needn't look so disappointed. I don't like it any better than you do. And with that, Becky runs off to join the other girls. Tom stands there, looking bewildered. Joe Harper joins him.

I think I just got married and divorced at the same time. Before Joe can question this, Old Tim shouts out to all the kids:

Who's ready for the cave? With whoops and cheers, the children assemble. Torches are handed out and Old Tim leads the throng up a trail toward t gaping hole in the side of the mountain -- MacDongal's Cave. CUT To:

Tom...

Huckleberry. Injun Joe advances, knife gleaming.
